lines.author: tom@organisms.be

lines.author: tom@organisms.be

lines.code: # This may be done in any of several ways:
lines.author: tom@organisms.be

lines.code: #   1. Respond to requests containing an Expect: 100-continue request
lines.author: tom@organisms.be

lines.code: #      with an immediate "100 Continue" response, and proceed normally.
lines.author: tom@organisms.be

lines.code: #   2. Proceed with the request normally, but provide the application
lines.author: tom@organisms.be

lines.code: #      with a wsgi.input stream that will send the "100 Continue"
lines.author: tom@organisms.be

lines.code: #      response if/when the application first attempts to read from
lines.author: tom@organisms.be

lines.code: #      the input stream. The read request must then remain blocked
lines.author: tom@organisms.be

lines.code: #   3. Wait until the client decides that the server does not support
lines.author: tom@organisms.be

lines.author: tom@organisms.be
